sources.title: The Ten Gladiators (1963) [Action] [Adventure] [Comedy]
sources.description:
"The Ten Gladiators" (I dieci gladiatori) is an Italian film directed by Gianfranco Parolini. The movie is about Rocca and his band of fellow gladiators, which joined forces with a patrician named Glaucus Valerius to replace Nero with a new emperor. During the course of this bloody struggle, the gladiators lose their mentor and trainer ...

---

Directed by Gianfranco Parolini, written by Gianfranco Parolini, Giovanni Simonelli and Sergio Sollima, starring Dan Vadis as Rocca, José Greci as Lidia, Roger Browne as Glaucus Valerius, Franca Parisi as Poppea, Mimmo Palmara as Tigelinus, Gianni Rizzo as Claudius Nero, Giuliano Dell'Ovo as Gladiator, Milton Reid as Gladiator and Ivano Staccioli as Gladiator.

---

Source: "The Ten Gladiators" Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.. 9 April 2013. Web. 22 July 2013. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ten_Gladiators.

If you like this movie and our channel, please subscribe: https://goo.gl/atJwQv

Directed by Gianfranco Parolini, written by Gianfranco Parolini, Giovanni Simonelli and Sergio Sollima, starring Dan Vadis as Rocca, José Greci as Lidia, Roger Browne as Glaucus Valerius, Franca Parisi as Poppea, Mimmo Palmara as Tigelinus, Gianni Rizzo as Claudius Nero, Giuliano Dell'Ovo as Gladiator, Milton Reid as Gladiator and Ivano Staccioli as Gladiator.

metadata.Plot: Roccia and a band of fellow gladiators join forces with a patrician named Glaucus Valerius to replace Nero, (and his evil henchman, Tigelinus), with a new emperor: Servius Galba. During the course of this bloody struggle, the gladiators lose their mentor and trainer - Resius - and then must rescue Lidia, Resius' beautiful niece, from death on the cross.
metadata.Writer: Giovanni Simonelli, Sergio Sollima, Gianfranco Parolini
metadata.Actors: Roger Browne, José Greci, Dan Vadis
